dialogues.text: Tow Jerry's trailer to a remote parking lot in Berkeley and burn it to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hitch ball grinds under the trailer socket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thus evicting myself from my mother's clutches and into the arms of My One And Only Love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick fires up the V-8 engine and shifts into drive, pulli forward. He cuts across the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FranГ§ois wanted to torch the trailer where it sits, but I've convinced him a parking lot will reduce the risk of collateral damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trailer clips the corner of the house. Chunks of stuc fall and the galvanized downspout shudders and writhes, collapsing the long rain gutter running across the front the home. Nick guns it, and with a lurch the trailer splinters free dodges the birch tree, but plows over the smaller Asian p The Lincoln bounces the curb and catapults into the stree the trailer weaving back and forth, smashing parked cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick cruises along sedately. He plays with the radio and settles on the Sex Pistols. He looks up just in time to see the red light and slams o the brakes, nearly jack-knifing the trailer. The light turns green and the car lumbers up the long hil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick hits the bump in the road right before the stop sign The car bottoms out. The trailer bounces up, coming unhitched.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. LINCOLN, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: Nick hits the gas and the Lincoln suddenly surges forward released from the great weight. Nick smiles. Behind him, through the rear window, the tra can be seen receding into the distance. He glances into t mirror and spots the trailer plunging down the hill. Then he crashes into the Fiat parked in front of him at t intersection. The gas tank on the Fiat cracks, spurting f onto the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick leaps from the Lincoln and watches open-mouthed as t vehicular ballet unfolds. Down the hill - the speeding trailer sideswipes a deliver van and goes into a spin. The BOHEMIANS sipping espresso the outdoor cafГ© look up to see the words GOD'S PERFECT ASSHOLE bearing down on them. The delivery van veers out of control. The Bohemians scat The truck runs over a fire hydrant and smashes its way through the patio furniture and into the cafГ©. A geyser of water plumes where the hydrant once stood. The trailer resumes its downward plunge toward the busy c street below. KWOMP! Nick turns to see the still-restive Lincoln part f the Fiat and begin to roll down the hill after its partne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no! I forgot to set the brake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DRIVER OF THE FIAT bolts after the accelerating Linco but as he realizes the futility, slows to a jog. The driver turns to see he forgot to set his own brake, a desperately rolls out of the way of the Fiat. MOTORISTS slam on their brakes as the speeding trailer crosses four lanes of traffic. It jumps the curb crashing into the plate glass window of a gourmet sausage shop. A cop car lights up and speeds into the intersection, jus time to get clipped by the Lincoln. The cop car goes into a tail spin, smashing into a chicke transport. The flock of feathered inmates fly for freedom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln continues to generate momentum on its slalom thundering past the stopped cars and into the wrecked building like a runaway express train. The gas cannisters in the trunk ignite and the sausage sh explodes, the trailer's two propane tanks going off like bombs. The Fiat comes flying into the flaming mess and blasts ap sending shards of metal and sausage links to go raining d on the spectators. The blaze lights the trail of gasoline left by the broken fuel tank and a stream of liquid fire races up the hill, ending at Nick's feet. Nick takes a moment to watch in horror as dark plumes of smoke billow into the sky, the geyser of water, the storm dazed chickens. He turns around and does his best to inconspicuously walk OUT OF FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE FOLLOW Nick as he comes through the front door and is with the sight of his mother and Lance staring at him fro the kitchen table. The Berkeley fire rages on the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mom! How was the movie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You little shit. You stole your mother's dead ex-boyfriend's trailer and set a five million dollar fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I refuse to stand for such allegations!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick! They have a description of the arsonist!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance flips through his notebook and reads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A white teenage male, about five- seven. A hundred and twenty five pounds, dark hair, spotted complexion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That could be anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was also wearing a tee shirt with the words: I'm single, let's mingle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick glances down at the lettering on his shirt. Oops. Estelle bursts into tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I going to do? My only son will be sent to prison!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance takes Estelle in his arms and smirks at Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Lance, can't something be done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what, Estelle. I'll make out that Nick reported the car and trailer stolen before the fire. It'll be less suspicious. But I could take some serious heat for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Lance! You're wonderful! How can I possibly repay you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll think of something, Estelle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her ass a playful squeeze. She lets out a giggle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the kid better not be here when the detectives start coming around. I'd send him away for a while. A long while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can go make his father's life miserable!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick suddenly brightens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I like it here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going, buster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She snatches up the phone and dials. George's groggy voic can be heard answering. Estelle screams into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're son just burned down half of Berkeley! Come and get the little brat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, Estelle, aren't you going to punish him? I'd say he deserves a good hiding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cupping the squawking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's too much for me anymore. Can you do it, Lance, darling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance gives Nick another smirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick let's out a yelp of pain as Lance brings a broken tr limb against his bare bottom. WHACK! WHACK! WHACK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't scream much. I am making a painful sacrifice for The Woman Of My Dreams. My suffering possesses a beauty which elevates it above this sordid scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the final blow the tree limb cracks in half. Nick lo over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you through?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance looks around the room. Picks up an umbrella and considers it in his hand. Nick hangs his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We find Nick waiting in the drive with a pile of suitcase beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Psst. Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick finds Lefty lurking in the shrubs that divide his mother's lawn from the neighbor's. He limps to his friend

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wondering what happened to you. Did you get to blow your wad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I did not get to blow my wad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get interrupted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's worse than being interrupted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Millie is a lesbian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only reason she wanted to hang out with me is because she heard that I showed you my slinky and thought I was gay too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, man. I didn't have a great night either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I dunno what you're gonna do, but I'm giving suicide serious consideration this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or you could just fake it and then hide out in Ukiah with me. Then later come back and maybe Millie Filbert will boink you out of pity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's not a bad idea. Thanks a pantsful, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of headlights swing into the drive and Lefty ducks of sight. The headlights turn out to belong to George Twi BMW. The driver's side window rolls down to reveal Nick's dad. Lacey leans over George's seat to wave at Nick through th window and show him some of her cleavage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya, Nick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Lacey. Hi, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trunk pops open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there any way I could sit up front with Lacey, Dad? Mom's boyfriend beat me pretty badly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Nick. In this car, faggots get the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. BMW 325I, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: Nick is in the back, crowded in by his belongings and Alb They ride in tense silence until they pass the sight of t fire, where FIRE FIGHTERS sift through the ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God. Look what you've done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lacey turns to look at Nick over the seat. They share a smile.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Morning peers over the distant hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BMW pulls into the drive of the house - a plywood rectangle perched on cement blocks. Aluminum windows. A s cooler on the shallow-pitched roof. They all emerge from car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead and bring your stuff inside. Lacey and I need a nap. C'mon, Sugar Puss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick watches longingly as George leads Lacey into the hom As he places his hand on Lacey's ass, he looks back over shoulder and throws a smug look in Nick's direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a competitive asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick reaches the door and gently knocks. But it's Sheeni' ogre of a father who answers the door and stares at Nick sternly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhm, hello. Is Sheeni available?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She most certainly is not. As a matter of fact, we've banned you from her life, Nick Twisp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trent Preston informed us that not only were you moving here to pursue my daughter, but that you're not even mentally-handicapped, and thus molested my wife in the shower of sound mind and body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That rat-fink-fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You watch your language. This is a Christian home. We're sending Sheeni to Les Г‰cole des Arts and Literatures in Santa Cruz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santa Cruz! But she'll be miserable without me. We're in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ogre snorts in condescending amusement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I guess it's a good thing Trent is going there too. She'll have someone to console her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, Mr. Saunders slams the door so hard in Nic face that the entire two story mobile home rocks back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick makes his way past the arbor, crestfallen. Sheeni emerges from the shadows in a hooded sweatshirt over a lavender dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick! Oh, Nick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick lights up at the sight of her and they embrace. They kiss passionately. He works his way to her neck and start reach under the sweatshirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to sneak away just to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. I had to burn down half of Berkley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was you? Nick, are you out of your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt a grand gesture was required, darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni's expression indicates that she is touched, but it turns to troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, Trent betrayed us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FranГ§ois will kill him later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's FranГ§ois?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nevermind. The point is we must elope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni takes a step back at the notion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Nick. I do love you, but I don't want to spend the rest of our lives on the run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a small price to pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes another step back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I can't, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!? But, Sheeni. I just don't get it. I'm here. Albert's here too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Nick, and I've been longing for you so. But we'll just have to find another way. The car is already packed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick nods glumly and Sheeni seems overcome with remorse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick Twisp, I will not allow you to accept defeat so easily!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEENI (cont'd) When the time is right, you must make your way to Santa Cruz. And then we will make love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick lifts his gaze with renewed determination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or we could consummate here in the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you bring the consumer reports?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick just blinks blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it will have to be Santa Cruz. I really must go now, darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... Goodbye, Sheeni. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too. Squeeze darling Albert for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls her hood over her head. Nick watches wistfully she slips away into the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have endured a five million dollar beating for nothing. (BEAT) I have been stabbed. Stabbed in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two WRESTLERS slam down onto the mat below us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not have a friend within a hundred miles. This is a daunting thought if you think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE TRACK down the row of other students, starting with a THREE HUNDRED POUND BEHEMOTH. The row seems to descend in weight class, until we reach Nick at the very end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick does his best to not be pinned by DWAYNE CRAMPTON, w out-weighs him by at least 40 pounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick rinses off. Dwayne steps up to the shower head next his. Nick glances his way and quickly recoils at the repelling landscape of rolling pink flab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry `bout wompin' ya. I'm Dwayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick. Nick Twisp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, Nick? Why do you suppose guys got only two testicles when we got ten fingers and toes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could not begin to speculate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick turns off his shower and slinks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick comes up the dusty road toting his backpack. On the porch of the Saunders' home, a handsome but somewh unkempt PAUL SAUNDERS, mid-twenties, blows cool jazz on a beat-up trumpet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Nick. I'm Paul, Sheeni's brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick comes up the path to meet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Paul. How did you know my name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No we haven't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a previous life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul begins rolling a joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice fire in Berkeley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Sheeni tell you that was me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Was I an arsonist in a previous life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But Sheeni was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God. What did she burn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men. Men and boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul hands the joint out to Nick. He regards it dubiously

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty hallway. PSYCHEDELIC SOUND plays. Nick comes around the corner, literally floating down the hall. He breaststrokes through the air toward us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He passes just under the door frame and comes down, feet touching carpet. He looks into the mirror and finds FranГ lounging on the bed behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, FranГ§ois! What was Paul smoking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up and go with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick shrugs and opens the top dresser drawer, revealing Lacey's lingerie. Nick starts dancing, doing a strip tease for himself. WE AROUND the room, and when we reach Nick again, he's weari nothing but a pair of Lacey's thongs. He models in front of the mirror, regarding his bulging T He removes a C-cup bra and holds it high. He uses the ela straps to fasten the bra onto his head. He starts dancing up a storm to the cheesy Vengaboys rendition of BRAZIL in his head. Waving arms. Bicycling l movements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he backs up we can see that George is watching him fro the doorway, a Safeway bag in his arms. Lacey peers over shoulder. The MUSIC halts abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the... What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick gives a startled jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is..? Is that my bra?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick sits at the table, considerably more clothed and sob George works on a jug of zin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're calling that fruitcake display strike one. Two more strikes and it's back to Oakland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick nods. The front door opens and MRS. CRAMPTON enters Safeway bags of her own. Dwayne follows close behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Nick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Albert barks and jumps at Dwayne's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... Hi, Dwayne. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't ya heard. We're gonna be roommates! Ain't that zinky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks to his father in horror as Dwayne goes chasing after the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne, get yer dumb ass back here and take yer sleepin' pill. You must be Nick. Wash yer hands, boy. I don't serve two shifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... Dad? What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Crampton's our new housekeeper. I'm renting out the spare room to her seeing as her camper has been deemed unfit for human habitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Dwayne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's bunking with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You working on strike two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick leans back and glares in silent protest as everyone takes their seats at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick tries to shut out the sound of Dwayne getting into t creaky bed behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, Nick. You wanna sleep in bed with me? It'll be tons warmer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thank you, Dwayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A knock at the door. Lacey enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This came for you, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick sits up in bed to receive the letter. As Lacey leave he tears through the wax seal and unfolds its contents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it a love letter, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, it's in French. Say, why does your mother give you sleeping pills?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Cuz otherwise I'd stay up all night playin' Nintendo Wii. Say, Nick, can I walk Albert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Dogs don't grow on trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleeease, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. But it will cost you one sleeping pill per walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatchu want them pills for, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never know when sedatives will come in handy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick emerges from the home. He makes his way down the roa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops at the familiar sight of My Green Haven. He gets amused smile and sighs with nostalgia. The front door of the trailer opens and Lefty emerges. Ni furrows his brow in confusion as Lefty locks the door and comes down the path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lefty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Hey, Nick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lefty, what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I live here. The guy's only charging me fifty in cash a month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, what are you doing in town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did what you told me, Nick. I threw my backpack off the pier and reported my own suicide. I even left a note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, Lefty, I'm kinda impressed. Faking your suicide is pretty ballsy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lefty joins Nick in his walk down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where you headed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redwood High School.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you want to go to school if you didn't have to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's weird, Nick, but school seems like a pretty fun place to hang out once you get rid of classes and homework.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see this stunt really has liberated your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, Nick: killing myself was the best thing that ever happened to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rowdy cafeteria. Lefty and Nick dine in the corner. Nic has an open French textbook as he tries to decipher Sheen letter. An Indian boy, VIJAY JOSHI, 16, makes his way to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I sit at your table?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. I'm Lefty and this is Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Vijay Joshi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vijay sits and shakes their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you both have been rejected by the socially elite of our school. Ukiah is a cultural wasteland compared to India. Though some of the girls are very attractive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at the moment. But I am optimistic. How about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but she transferred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't mean Sheeni Saunders. I heard she was interested in some brilliant fellow in the Bay Area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's you, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm surprised. You are not at all what I imagined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick narrows his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how is Sheeni?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. She sent me this letter. But it's in French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall I translate it for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You speak French?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I speak French, English, Hindi, Marathi, and Urdu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That must come in handy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick hands over the letter and Vijay starts reading it silently. He chuckles as he reads and Nick squints his ey at him in annoyance. Vijay picks up on it, clears his throat and reads aloud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear, Nick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Nick's imagination, Sheeni puts pen to paper at her de which affords a view of the sun setting on the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I am writing you from my room in Santa Cruz. Surprisingly, boarding school has proven to be a welcome liberation as well as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a stimulating experience which I am now not so quick to change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni slips into a nightgown as other GIRLS walk around scantily clad behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you should consider learning French and enrolling. That said...

dialogues.speaker: INT.
dialogues.text: Sheeni chats up a gathering of HANDSOME BOYS in the hall. They regard her lustfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...English cannot be spoken on campus even if you are hemorrhaging from an accidental limb amputation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have made friends with the head of the girls' basketball team. Her name is Heather, and despite her popularity, she is saving herself for college boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEATHER, a slender giantess, poses with the other members the BASKETBALL TEAM for a yearbook photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an interesting roommate from New York named Taggarty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAGGARTY, short dark hair, intense green eyes, Manhattan sophistication cloaked in fragile ripeness, snaps a Polar of a sleepy BOY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has already slept with seventeen boys and hopes to rack up fifty before leaving here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taggarty tacks the picture to a wall covered with Polaroi She writes the boy's grade (C-) beneath his image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The distant figure on the windsurf board can only be Tren

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trent has taken up windsurfing and has been designated target number one by all the girls. I am still very angry at him for the betrayal but he claims he wants to mend our friendship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure falls into the surf and the crowd of watching BIKINI-CLAD GIRLS gasp in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we shall see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (READING) All in all, I'm happy and look forward to further growth in this rich, intellectual environment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vijay sets down the letter. Nick waits a beat, staring in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it? Nothing else about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vijay picks up the letter again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes... Love to you and Albert. (setting down the letter) Who's Albert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Albert is our dog. This is a disaster. What the hell does she mean Trent wants to mend the relationship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, but this Taggarty girl sounds very uninhibited. I wonder if she's made it with a Hindu yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather sounds like a babe. You think if I grew a beard I'd pass for college age?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to get to Sheeni as soon as possible. If I don't Trent Preston is going to mindfuck her into thinking she doesn't like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then he'll probably fuck her in other ways. Did you know you're supposed to put your pinkie in a girl's bumhole, Vijay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you shut up and help me out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Nick. What should we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suggest we steal my father's BMW and take a trip to Santa Cruz. Vijay, you'll have to be our translator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what will we tell our parents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can tell your father you are staying at Nick's house for the weekend. And visa versa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if we are caught?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To hell with it, Vijay. It's time to take action!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE CUTS. The JINGLE as Nick removes his Dad's keys fro the bureau. The trunk SLAMMING closed with the sleeping b inside. The ROAR of the engine as Vijay's hand turns the in the ignition.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. BMW 325I, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: As Vijay drives, Lefty holds up a road map in the back se Nick places a CD in the stereo and TAKE FIVE fills the ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this music, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Dave Brubeck. (to Vijay) I thought a person as cultured as yourself would appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want culture? I will give you culture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vijay puts in his own CD and Ravi Shankar's TARANA blasts from the speakers. Nick gives Vijay a grin of approval. MUSIC PLAYS OVER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE FLY through the forest to keep up with the Beamer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BMW passes cars on the Golden Gate Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beamer navigates the winding curves of the highway wh green hills meet the Pacific Ocean.

dialogues.speaker: EXT.
dialogues.text: The car pulls to a stop in the parking lot, the school looming beyond, slightly obfuscated by a light drizzle. T music cuts out with the engine.

dialogues.speaker: EXT.
dialogues.text: The grouping of BOYS part as we move through them. Finall we reach the center of their attention... Sheeni, Taggarty, and Heather standing together in their coats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nickie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, Vijay, and Lefty are noticeably shorter than the ol boys around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Sheeni. (to Taggarty and Heather) Hi, I'm Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. So you're Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've heard so much about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is Vijay. And this is Lefty. Lefty goes to USC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm not gay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, I knew you'd come!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni glances over at the disapproving MATRON. She leans close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but you must wait in the car until we can sneak you in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick nods in understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty hall. The SNEAKY STRINGS of NIGHT ON BALD MOUNTA Sheeni rounds the corner at the far end. As she and Heath sneak the boys down, the other OCCUPANTS of the floor gig in French and dart from door to door in near-undress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cement cubicle just big enough for a bunk bed, two smal desks, an army surplus dresser, and a stuffed armchair. Sheeni pulls a nightgown from the dresser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lefty, should maybe sleep in my room. It's pretty crowded in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your roommate won't mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Darlene went home for the weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lefty gulps and picks up his grip. He pauses in the hallw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, see you guys in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door closes and Vijay and Nick exchange a knowing gla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me, everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni steps into the tiny closet to change. Vijay and Ni regard the...

dialogues.speaker: WALL OF TAGGARTY'S CONQUESTS
dialogues.text: a series of mug shots of sullen-looking TEENAGE BOYS. Mos them have been given a grade of C- or below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's your competition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A distinguished group I would be happy to join.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two boys turn around and watch in hot-blooded bliss a Taggarty searches for her misplaced nightie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two boys brush their pearlies over the grungy sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am in a state of sexual frenzy. What is your plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We drape a blanket over the lower bunk for Sheeni and me. You tackle Taggarty on the top bunk. Here's a condom. I slipped two to Lefty, leaving us with four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if they don't go for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll go for it. You can cut the sexual tension in that room with a knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be silly, darling. Not with others in the room. (leaning in to whisper) We must wait until everyone falls asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick tries to appear unconcerned. She gives him a kiss an climbs into her narrow bed. As Nick and Vijay prepare their sleeping bags on the floo they watch Taggarty climb up to her bunk in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight boys. Do you need the light on to take off your clothes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (flipping off the light) We can find our zippers in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat of BLACKNESS. Then a light tap at the door. There is the sound of Sheeni getting out of bed. She crac the door, letting in just enough light from the hall that MALE SHADOW gets cast across the two boys on the floor. Nick squints and tries to hear what Sheeni and the male shadow are whispering to each other. After a beat, Sheeni closes the door and the room plunges into BLACKNESS once again. Nick listens as Sheeni climbs into bed as if nothing happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that the matron?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Trent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you say it was Trent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He came to discuss our friendship. I told him now was not the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where is Trent now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I assume he went back to the boys' dorm. Now really, Nickie, you are keeping everyone awake with your inquiries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Though silence follows, we take a moment to allow Nick's to race in the dark. He stands and looks at the mirror ab the dresser. FranГ§ois can be made out sitting by the win in the moonlight, stroking the Thompson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now is our chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chance for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To confront our nemesis. We must go to the boys' dorm and kill Trent where he sleeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose we should at least get a look at him. To see what we're dealing with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. (stubbing out his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see what we are dealing with... and zen I wll deal wiz it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that he cocks the Thompson for dramatic flare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick emerges from the room in nothing but his underwear a whindbreaker. He creeps down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The school SECURITY VAN crawls by in the background, a searchlight sweeping the grounds. The moment it is out of sight, Nick darts from the bushes the girls' dorm and races across the campus to the boys' dorm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick makes his way down the hall, checking the names on t colored paper cut-out shapes that adorn the doors. He stops and backtracks when he spots the door that boast the names TRENT and ED. Nick knocks on the door. It opens inward to reveal a bare-chested, hulking athlete a pajama pants. This is ED SOLOMON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Who the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Nick Twisp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so you're Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Trent here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just missed him, Nick. He just grabbed a couple condoms and left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he say where he was going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he said he was going to Heather's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's where Lefty is. Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed. Ed Solomon. Trent's roommate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so you're Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. It's just that Sheeni mentioned Trent has a thing for a guy named Ed, and that he touches the guy when he falls asleep. But obviously if that were you, you'd know about it. Must be a different Ed Solomon. Take care now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick takes off running and Ed stares after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The security van continues to make its rounds. We find Ni crouching behind the steps to the boys dorm. He pulls the hood of his windbreaker over his head and ta a deep breath. As the searchlight passes by, he makes a break for it. TRACK with Nick as he darts from one form of cover to the next, perhaps accompanied by the imagined sounds of morta blasts and machine gun turret fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At long last he reaches the girls' dorm undetected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick bangs on the door. Heather answers in little more th G-string and Nick seems to forget his mission just long enough to appreciate her body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Trent in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to Lefty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm right here, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick peers past Heather where he finds Lefty standing nak in the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trent was here, but he left. He only dropped by to lend us a couple more condoms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I gave Lefty two already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, and that was very generous of you, but the night is young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what is Trent, the fucking condom faerie!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can have one of ours, Nick. If you need one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fact that Nick doesn't yet raises his temperament eve further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where did he say he was going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't say, but I'm pretty sure I just saw him go into our bathroom down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Oh, and I'd be careful with those condoms. Trent's roommate Ed said that Trent pokes holes in them so that he can get Sheeni pregnant and be with her forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that piece of disturbing info, he leaves them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is the CLAP of thunder outside as Nick throws open door to the girls' bathroom. He looks around with murdero rage. There comes the sound of someone vomiting. Nick kicks in the stall and finds BERNICE LYNCH, 17, a th platinum haired girl with six earrings per lobe. She hurl into the toilet again and turns around to find Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Sheeni's friend, Nick. Sorry to disturb you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's OK. It was something I ate. So wait, are you Sheeni's boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's Bernice. Bernice Lynch. Not that you asked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you Bernice. Actually, I think Trent Preston mentioned you. He said you were frumpy, but now that I've met you, I can see Trent is a lying bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. And Trent can go to hell for all I care. Sheeni too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like Sheeni?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personally, I hate her guts. Well, pardon me, Nick. I feel like throwing up some more now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't happen to see Trent Preston did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She waves him away as she bends over the sink to hurl aga Then lifts her face and smiles through the dripping bile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did actually. I think he was on his way to Sheeni's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's eyes widen in alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick enters the dark room to the sound of the bed squeaki Vijay and Taggarty grunt away on the top bunk. He watches the moon lit forms thumping together. He turns his attention to the sleeping beauty on the bott bunk. He moves toward her. She blinks, waking and smiles at the sight of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was Trent here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick hangs his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I sent him away again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stares into her eyes to discern her honesty, but he finds nothing but adoration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I want you, darling. Not even Trent can match the industriousness and tenacity with which you have pursued me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles. Nick smiles too. She reaches out to pull him her bed as... The door to the room slams open and they are suddenly bac by the harsh beam of the matron's flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Q'est que c'est passer ici?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick bolts upright, smacking his head against the top bun He lands on the floor, where he gets a view of... Trent standing behind the matron. The blinding light makes his features difficult to make out but his white teeth are definitely smiling diabolically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys come out of the front door of the dormitory, the matron, flanked by SCHOOL SECURITY GUARDS, hot on their heels. The girls in the dorm appear on the balcony in dro cheering the boys' escape. Vijay's pants fall to his ankles, tripping him up. Nick and Lefty grab Vijay by the arms and pull him up aga as if he were a wounded war buddy in a retreat from the Vietnamese Army. They reach the Beamer at the edge of the grounds. Nick ge in first. Lefty dives through the back window, legs kicki Vijay slams the door just as the matron and her security catches up to them. The authorities bang on the windows a Nick peels out. INDIAN POP blares from the car. They speed off into the night.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. BMW 325I, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: Lefty lets out a holler of joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did it three times! Two long ones and a quickie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Just great. How about you, Vijay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was difficult to tell with that condom, Nick. Why did you buy such thick ones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That brand was top-rated by Consumers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she's safe. No organism could penetrate those walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think the girls are in trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will likely notify their parents. Perhaps even expel them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it! Expel them. Then Sheeni will have to come back to Ukiah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car sputters. Nick's eyes go to the gas gauge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain is coming down again. Nick shivers in his underw Vijay isn't in much more and Lefty's sheet is drenched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we can't stay in the car. Sooner or later Highway Patrol is going to come by and ask for our non-existent driver's license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we have no money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no shoes! I'll catch pneumonia and die a indeterminate proto-quasi-virgin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple coins are inserted into a roadside pay phone. Th is ringing on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Mom? It's Nick. I'm sorry to wake you, but I'm hoping you'll help your only son. Especially seeing as it would really piss off Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three boys are still standing in the rain by the pay phone. The three of them huddle under their only windbrea A pair of headlights appear in the rain. The headlights f twice and Nick runs out into the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick waving frantically in nothing but tightie-whities. The truck pulls to a stop and the passenger door opens to reveal, the driver, a man named WALLY RUMPKIN, a seven fo tall giant in a plaid shirt and bib overalls. He looks do at our three waylaid adventurers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me. But is one of you Nick Twisp?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two other boys exchange confused glances, not entirel this is how people go missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Wally. I'm a friend of your mom's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick nods, not yet sure whether or not this gentle giant actually blushing with shyness or red with agitation at b sent on a midnight mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, uhm, uh... Your mom says you need a ride. Did I mention I'm a friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick breaks into a smile. Finally the Gods have cut him a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally and Estelle watch the three semi-clothed boys shove fried liver with no complaint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally was a friend of Jerry's. He came to help me in my time of mourning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to Lance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Estelle's face registers "none of your business," but a k look from Wally and she softens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance is busy training to be a detective. He isn't around as much as he used to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick nods and goes back to eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Rumpkin is very smart. Ask him a question, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Mr. Rumpkin, what famous actress was married to Frank Sinatra, Artie Shaw, and Mickey Rooney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever she is, she sure gets around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ava Gardner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Estelle smiles with pride. Nick and the other boys regard gentle giant with admiration. He bashfully averts his eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nothing. You should see what he did with the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and the other two boys pause in the doorway. Where once the Chevy occupied the space, the living room now fairly returned to it's normal uncluttered state with the furniture placed back in the original positions. At some point Wally must have sawed a hole in the wall sh by the living and dining areas because the Chevy now occu that hole and has been painted and decorated such that it achieved an almost seamless blend with the wall. Estelle goes and takes a seat on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, Wally. Show them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally blushes before he flips a switch and the tail light come on, giving the living room a warm, flattering glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooooh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally flips another switch and the car's radio turns on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaaaaah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally makes a slightly embarrassed gesture of scratching head before lumbering over to the couch and taking a seat next to Estelle. Nick watches as Wally puts his arm around his mother and listen to the Chevy play them Elvis' LOVE ME TENDER. The two adults snuggle in the glow of the tail lights and brings an unexpected rush of caring in his expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck rumbles to a stop and the three boys climb out. Nick looks, over his shoulder at Wally blushing behind th wheel of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, uhm... It was nice meeting you, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too, Mr. Rumpkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally blushes even more. He closes the door and starts to turn the truck around. Nick watches him go. Wally waves goodbye. Nick turns and the three boys make their way down the dus road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lacey works up a sweat to Billy Blank. Nick comes through door. He's still in his underwear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the bedroom. I wouldn't bother him, Nick. He's in a foul mood. He's on with the police. Apparently someone broke in and stole his Beamer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lacey gives Nick an amused smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lacey! Get in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lacey rolls her eyes and heads for the bedroom. Nick sits down with Dwayne at the breakfast table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, you got a girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you asked your girlfriend as a favor, would she do it with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys don't share their girlfriends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get ya. You're worried `cause your girlfriend might get knocked up. What if I pull out, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick seethes inwardly. There comes a ruckus from the back bedroom and Lacey emerges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not my fault, you tight-assed, critical, nonfeeling, sexist drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sticks and stones. It doesn't bother me if you sleep on the couch from now on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it bother you that you're a selfish, uptight, boring lover?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forgot lousy driver!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George appears in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's strike two, jerkoff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick hangs his head. George moves about the kitchen chugg from a jug of zin. Lacey picks up the ringing phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? (PAUSE) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lacey hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They found your car in Davenport, George. Go pick it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look who's wearing the pants this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lacey takes a seat next to Nick and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, I feel for you. It must be tough being a teenager in this house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother wasn't any better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom has had a difficult time. She has had a great deal to put up with. I'm starting to appreciate that now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you by any chance referring to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the shoe fits, suck on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George swills some zin and mumbles ominously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see who's sucking on what soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spoke with Taggarty this morning. She requested a wallet sized photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks up glumly from his lunch. Lefty has his feet u the table, his facial growth is almost respectable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Vijay. That makes it official. Welcome to the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick narrows his eyes at the two non-virgins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What grade did you receive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A C+. Which I feel is perfectly satisfactory given the conditions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess this means they're not being expelled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, apparently they convinced the matron it was all quite innocent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? She had her flashlight trained on your Hindi boner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. Lefty and Vijay seem taken aback by the outburst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need to be jealous, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stands and collects his lunch tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'm to get Sheeni expelled and sent back to me I will need a partner in crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick enters the computer lab and finds an open machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luckily, FranГ§ois has a girl on the inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick begins typing and speaking out loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Bernice, it was nice meeting you this weekend in the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernice reads the letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want you to know I now see why you loath Sheeni Saunders so strongly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni, Taggarty, and Heather sit across from the HEADMAS as the matron describes the events.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I too have come to despise the snooty, pretentious brunette and in all honesty you should probably get her expelled. I am happy to help in that regard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have included a number of sleeping pills with this note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernice dumps the pills from the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must introduce one of these into her breakfast beverage each day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernice sits next to Sheeni, despite the fact she's being ignored. Bernice drops a pill into Sheeni's coffee nonchalantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni watches the INSTRUCTOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She may be intelligent, but she is not likely to pass her courses when she's falling asleep in class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni's head slips off her hand as she drifts off. We MO across the classroom to where Bernice scribbles in her notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since meeting you, I have come to realize my interest in Sheeni was only a transient adolescent infatuation. I like you more than I can say. Take courage. Together we will outsmart these cake eaters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A view of the notebook shows her to be scribbling Nick's with hearts. She flips through pages of obsession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's fingers fly across the keys. He looks pleased with himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Affectionately yours, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around for observers, looks back at the screen pensively, and resumes typing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.S. Please destroy this note immediately.

dialogues.speaker: ON A MAILBOX
dialogues.text: As Nick deposits his letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick wanders up the drive. WE FOLLOW him into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...where he comes upon the sight of Paul giving Lacey a f message on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DREAMILY) Daddy is in Davenport. Where you left his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We saved you some mushrooms, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick watches the sensual foot message. He picks up the ba full of mushrooms and considers them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick pukes his guts into the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's in bed reading Lovemaking for Advanced Gourmets. He glances up at Dwayne playing Nintendo and scowls. There comes the strange warbled sound of a TRUMPET from t next room, and it is joined by other instruments until we hear The Nutley Brass' rendition of I WANT TO BE SEDATED. Nick furrows his eyebrows in confusion.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BOOK
dialogues.text: as the nude figures suddenly BECOME ANIMATED, making wonderful love. Nick follows them with his eyes as they float off the pag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE FOLLOW Nick as he follows the nude figures who do acrobatics down...

dialogues.speaker: THE HALL
dialogues.text: and into...

dialogues.speaker: THE LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: where Lacey watches Paul blow on his trumpet. Nick marvels. The phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick? Get the phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick picks up the phone and Paul takes his place at Lacey feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: I/E. BMW 325I, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: George cradles the cell phone. WE INTERCUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick? Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Nick Twisp. I am alive. I am a breathing organism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit fooling around, Nick. This is your dad. Is everything okay there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid, Dad. Everything will be okay. You deserve to be loved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that supposed to mean? Is Lacey there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lacey is here. Paul is caressing her toes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul! Who the hell is Paul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul is our friend. He makes beautiful music for the acrobats. They're naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's naked? Is Lacey naked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid, Dad. Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up the phone and pulls out the cord. He joins Paul in working Lacey's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad is afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is on the wrong path. I have felt that for some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick watches the headlights from the arriving BMW travel across the walls. They go out. He listens to the front door being keyed followed by his father bellowing. Nick gets up and wanders into...

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: where Paul stands between George and Lacey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, George, just calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George lunges and Paul socks him in the eye, dropping him the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are in serious trouble. You've assaulted me and I know for a fact that you two were having naked orgies with my son. That child is only twelve years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sixteen, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut your pie hole! (turning to Lacey and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That boy is an underaged minor. I'm going to have you arrested and charged with child molesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be an idiot, George. No one was naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you get out of prison, you will both have to register as sex offenders. You will never be able to get a decent job again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never had a decent job. I don't think I'd want one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, Paul. George, I'll pick up the rest of my things tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not until you pay me the rest of the money you owe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I paid you all your money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the extra charges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck-your-stinking-extra-charges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Lacey and Paul depart, Nick turns and dreamily wanders back toward his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using bad language in front of a minor. The judge will hear about that too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick gets back into his room and closes the door behind h SWISH TO... Dwayne playing Nintendo naked. He looks over shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's all the ruckus about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne! Please cover yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna play Nintendo all night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not. I'm tired. Let's go to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick unplugs the Nintendo and climbs into bed. Dwayne jus sits there on the floor, naked as a clam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strange night. I dreamed of wrestling for what seemed like hours with an amorous walrus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick squirms with an amorphous blob, they wrestle against red abstract background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's bleary eyes snap open and wander to the floor, whe his pajamas lie in a crumpled pile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is only one explanation: I have been Dwayned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pillow whacks across a blubbery face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up! I know what you were doing last night, you disgusting beast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be mad, Nick. I like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne throws off his sheets. Nick shudders at the sight. ...which is when Mrs. Crampton barges in..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys, time to get-- AHH! Dwayne! Where's yer pajamas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick made me take them off, Mom. He took off his too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You leave my son alone. Don't go co'rupt him with yer nastiness!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We weren't doing anything, Mrs. Crampton. It was just hot last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you get hot, boys, open a window. Don't go takin' off yer pajamas. That's nasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick dials on the phone. Behind him, Dwayne eats breakfas cheerfully kicking his feet back and forth under the chai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bonjour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taggarty? It's Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taggarty's at her desk. Her thick rimmed glasses almost m her look studious. WE INTERCUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Nick. I suppose you want to talk to Sheeni.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taggarty crosses to the bunks, where Sheeni is curled up among the sheets as if in some Renaissance portrait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your would-be-lover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni sleepily takes the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, My Beloved. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so well. I have been afflicted with some kind of chronic fatigue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you are home sick. You do sound rather blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEENI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not home sick, Nick. In fact, I'm not very happy with you. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? What did I do? SHEENI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know damn well, Nick. You've been spreading rumors about Trent. And he doesn't deserve it. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't deserve it!?! I'd have to claim he has genital warts to sink to his level. SHEENI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, whatever you said to Ed Solomon, it was enough to get him to give Trent a black eye. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni, I just don't get it. This guy has cock-blocked at every turn and you're taking his side?!? SHEENI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cock-blocked? (SIGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to resume this another time, Nick. It's been an emotionally exhausting weekend. My parents are in an uproar over Paul. He's moved some floozie in with him up in the studio over the garage. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lacey's not a floozie. SHEENI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lacey? You know her? NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. She's my father's ex- girlfriend. I think that might make you my stepmother-in-law. SHEENI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick. Don't be gross. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. At any rate, I'll let you go. We'll have plenty of time to settle this tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Sheeni, Thanksgiving. I'll be coming for dinner, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even think it, Nick. You know my parents don't approve of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm confident they will learn to love me. After all, I'm practically family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, you must dismiss this Thanksgiving notion from your mind. I remain firm on this issue. Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK. Nick regards the phone defensively. He puts it dow and takes a seat at the table. He glares at Dwayne as they eat breakfast. There comes a knock at the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move, blubber boy, I'll get it.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. GEORGE'S MANUFACTURED HOME
dialogues.text: A POLICE OFFICER stands on the steps. Nick goes wide eyed the sight of him and visibly slumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is George Twisp in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I'm pretty sure he's sleeping off a hangover, Officer. Is he under arrest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under arrest? No, I'm the officer working the case of his stolen car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can tell your pop that the CD he found in his car is Ravi Shankar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indian music. So we're a checkin' the INS files, see if we can get some prints that match. You wouldn't know anyone who might have stolen the car who listens to this crap, would ya, son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, and I'm not sure I like the implication. Ravi Shankar is beloved by many Caucasian...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Vijay Joshi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stands stiff as a board. The officer peers around hi Dwayne sitting inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pretty sure he's Injun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officer makes a note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Vijay Joshi. We'll look into it. Thank you, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick gives a weak smile and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Crampton complained to Dad that I tried to corrupt the fat pervert cohabitating with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick totes boxes of belongings from the house to the Crampton's dilapidated camper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has deemed it strike three, but is only banishing me as far as Mrs. Crampton's condemned trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A view of the thin birch walls. We come to rest on Nick, shivering under an electric blanket. There's a blob of sn on his upper-lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter. Tomorrow I will be reunited with My Everlasting Love. And I will not be stopped. Not by an outbreak of the plague, nor by a cruel return of the ice-age. Not even by the Gods themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The velvet voices of the Rat Pack come from the home. Nick emerges from the Camper wrapped in the electric blan He scurries into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick showers. Nick straightens his Garcia tie in the mirror. He applies hair gel. Nick examines the whitehead on his brow. He pinches and a glob of puss smacks the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He emerges into the hall and dances with an invisible par into the...

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: where the phone RINGS. He flips off the stereo with the remote and snatches up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twisp residence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Hey, Mom. What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nickie, I have some bad news!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'm ready. What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid Lance and Wally got into a terrible row. He tried to arrest Wally and Wally broke Lance's jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the bad news?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Berkeley police know you started the fire. Lance told them where you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick glances up and sees the black and white patrol car pulling up outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, they're coming to arrest you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams down the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The window slides open and Nick comes crawling out, leapi to the ground. He takes off running through the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick pounds on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick turns to find Lefty coming up the path with two bags groceries under his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lefty, have you seen Vijay, today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, haven't you heard? Vijay's been arrested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrested?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For grand theft auto. They found his prints in your father's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's terrible. Did he go quietly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He said you were his accomplice and now the Ukiah police are looking for you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We linger a beat on Nick's blank expression. Then -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're off and running through the woods, trying to keep u with Nick as he flees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The day has proven to be a disaster. Where did I gone wrong? I have a decision to make.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spotlight from the overhead helicopter sweeps over th bridge and continues down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could hit the road and spend my life a fugitive with my integrity nearly intact.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Nick squats in the shadows. He's holding a bouquet of municipal flowers and dabs the sweat on his head with his tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's that or risk incarceration to keep my dinner date. (BEAT) Obviously the answer is clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick peers through the bushes at the mobile home across t street. A squad car crawls past, the rover squawking a te description of a teenage white male. Nick emerges from the shrubs and approaches the house. He rings the ornate Victorian doorbell. Paul answers in a apron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Nick. Right on time. Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lacey floats toward him and gives him a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy Thanksgiving, Lacey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spots the sad flowers in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What interesting flowers, Nick. Who are they for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Mrs. Saunders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lacey leads him by the hand into the chintz-bedecked parl Sheeni's larger-than-life father and 5,000 year old mothe sit cross-legged on the floor, running their hands over t hooked rug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. and Mrs. Saunders, you remember Nick Twisp, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Saunders coos and takes the flowers. Her husband squ up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are very, very tall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No he's not, Dad. He just appears tall because you are on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can feel the floor pushing against me. Can you feel it too, tall youth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick glances over at Mrs. Saunders who is now eating the flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul served an appetizer earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it's a recipe I picked up in the Southwest. Stuffed mushrooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick smiles with amusement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
