dialogues.text: Taggarty makes her entrance down the stairs, cloaked in a green cape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is the star-crossed persistent lover?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She greets him with a casually intimate kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I guess. Where's Sheeni?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upstairs, Nick. She saw you coming and hid in her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick knocks and enters to find Sheeni sprawled on the bed with a book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner is almost ready, My Love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not intend to be party to my brother's absurdities. He has allowed you in and drugged my parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they are deriving some good from the experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni finally looks up from her book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here, Nick? I expressly asked you not to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To hell with that. What do I have to do to prove my love to you? My friends have gotten laid and I'm pretty sure neither one of them was beaten with a tree trunk, raped by a walrus, or had to contend with the likes of Trent Preston!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were raped by a walrus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni, I have shown restraint, I have committed crimes, I have traveled to the lengths of the state and still you won't give me this one little thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sex, Nick. Why don't you just say it? That's what you want. You want me to have sex with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BEAT) Well... YEAH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat as Nick's open admissions makes her consider his point. She sighs and shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is my dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent. He should be coming out of the oven right about now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tosses the book at him, but he dodges it successfully

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate you, Nickie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands up and tries to slap him. He grabs her wrists pulls her to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a long, intense kiss. They break away and she smiles in spite of herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Saunders and extended family take their seats at the polished mahogany table crammed with turkey, yams, mashed potatoes, and cranberry sauce. They all lower their heads and Lacey leads them in prayer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Lord...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Saunders emits a long, low, fog horn of a fart that e badly. The others exchange glances but he and his wife still hav their heads solemnly bowed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Lord, thank you for this bounty. Help us to be tolerant of others - especially the boyfriends and girlfriends of our immediate relations. Amen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They begin eating. A helicopter passes by outside, search light briefly coming through the windows. Nick watches Mr. Saunders take a handful of mashed potato and apply it to his face like war paint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul? Your father looks rather strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, mother, he is sitting in his own bowel movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's no excuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another helicopter passes overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The food is delicious, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. (BEAT) Sister, darling, how long has it been since we all observed the rituals of Thanksgiving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not long enough, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope it's the first of many such occasions for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni narrows her eyes at him. A long beat as they all dine in silence. Then- Mrs. Saunders croaks out in song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Siiiilent night, Hooooly night/ Aaaall in calm, aaall is bright...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul begins humming approvingly and one by one the others accompany her as Mr. Saunders pretends to conduct them wi drumstick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Round yon virgin Mother and Child/ Holy infant so tender and mild/ Sleep in heavenly peace... Sle-eep in heavenly pee-eace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, the doorbell rings. Taggarty gets up and o the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Trent, you made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick glances up with a start as TRENT PRESTON makes his entrance. He's not quite the deity Nick's expected, but rather a fairly plain, blond with slightly androgenous features and a certain flamboyance. His black eye, courte of Ed Solomon, still remains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Taggarty. Hello, Everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Saunders grunts his acknowledgement as he takes the pitcher and pours water into his own lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trent, darling, this is Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trent swivels slowly around and they lock eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, at last we meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Trent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a seat, Trent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Taggarty, I can't stay. I have bad news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernice Lynch has tried to commit suicide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni and Taggarty gasp. Nick swallows hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She swallowed a number of sleeping pills, and is now in a coma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The poor girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's more. Before I left school, I searched her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you obtain proper authorization from the officials?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Nick, I acted on my own initiative. In Bernice's closet, I found this letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dramatically extracts the letter from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the letter, the writer instructed Bernice to begin sedating Sheeni with drugs he himself supplied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, you didn't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick! You could have killed me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one yet, Mr. Saunders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Saunders points a liver spotted finger in his direct

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARREST HIM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't arrest him. But I have called the Santa Cruz Police. They are on their way here now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick places his napkin next to his plate and stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I shall be going now. Please continue without me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, I suggest you remain here and face the consequences like a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stops in front of Trent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for that unsolicited counsel, Trent. And please, do drop dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other guests murmur their shock. Nick stops in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Sheeni. I did it all for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are completely contemptible, Nick Twisp. I never wish to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the dreadful proclamation ringing in his ears, Nick leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's silhouette figure racing through the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here I am, reviled by friends and family. Relentlessly pursued by three police jurisdictions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stops at the edge of the woods to catch his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FronГ§ois suggests we flee the country. But where to go? Mexico? Canada? India, perhaps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up the road which has been blocked off by flashi squad cars.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The downtown high-rises protrude from the layer of smog. pre-lap, someone pushes a door BUZZER repeatedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joanie opens the door and finds Nick on her doorstep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Hi, Joanie. How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since my sister can see through me, I'm obliged to give a relatively candid and thorough review of the events.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joanie listens gravely, shaking her head at the most grue parts of the story. Nick finishes, flopping into a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, six months ago you were just another brownnosing honor student. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not really sure. I fell in love with Sheeni. All I want is to be with her. The rest is all a big misunderstanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, you've stolen, vandalized, trespassed, and burned down Berkeley. All for one girl. If there's a misunderstanding, it's with your insight into females.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... But where did I go wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, boys your age are always looking for the path of least resistance to becoming a man. A boy's whole self-esteem rests on how fast he can get a girl into bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So far, I agree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sooner or later what those boys realize, is that the girls you're chasing base their self-esteem on how many hoops they can get the boy to jump through before going to bed with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick furrows his brow. Clearly that had not occurred to h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I guess what you should ask yourself is: How far are you willing to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick nods in understanding. An epiphanic smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the way, Joanie. I'm willing to go all the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joanie nods in amusement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can stay here a couple days, but eventually they'll come looking for you. I don't have much money to give you, but here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick takes the wad of cash, clearly moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Joanie. I... Uh... I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too, you little brat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick slaps the cash on the counter and slides it under th window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One ticket to Ukiah, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance squats on the toilet in a neck brace. He chuckles o an issue of Penthouse. The phone rings. He picks it up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, bacon boy, it's Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, ya little prick, where are ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is crammed into the phone booth. He's wearing shades a fedora. WE INTERCUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on a need to know basis, gorilla boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance seethes inwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter, they'll get you eventually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me make it easy. I'll be at Redwood High School tomorrow morning. Round up your donut dipping friends. I'm turning myself in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick slams down the phone before Lance can respond.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. BUS, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: Nick sits by the window, the suitcase on the seat next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the bus flies past the sign that says WELCOME TO UKIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick steps off the bus and finds Lefty loading his belong underneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lefty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lefty lifts his eyes and sees his friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick? What are you doing here? Everyone and their mother's mother is looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have me soon enough. Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home. I'm done being dead, Nick. Heather and I are going back to Oakland for Christmas. You should have heard how glad my parents were that I didn't kill myself. They were even happier when they found out I'm not gay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great, Lefty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, being in love is pretty great. So what's your plan, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick answers with only pensive silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is about to knock on the door when Paul opens it in another display of clairvoyance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome back, Nick. We had a feeling you were coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick sits beside Paul and Lacey on the couch as they watc the infamous "chicken scene" in REBEL WITHOUT A CAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Lacey are kind enough to share some leftover fungi to help calm my nerves. That, combined with yet another viewing of James Dean's performance is what gives me my final burst of inspiration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all watch transfixed as JAMES DEAN leaps from his automobile just in time to escape demise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the END CREDITS of REBEL play behind them, Lacey fits bombshell wig on Nick's head and finishes the last touche make-up that make him... ...who we will come to know as CARLOTTA ULANSKY. Nick reg his female alter-ego in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FranГ§ois of course wants no part of this, and demands that we make a run for the border. But I have decided to veto him. It's time to face the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick turns the key in the ignition and CHRISTMAS MUSIC ri from the speakers. And the music plays over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...where a crowd begins to form in anticipation of Nick's arrival. Nick watches from behind a tree on the ridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...where police cars and news crews are pulling up to interview the students.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parking lot is now filled with police cruisers and FB vans, the news crews, REDWOOD HIGH STUDENTS, and an apparently CALIFORNIA WIDE NICK TWISP CULT FOLLOWING. TINA MANION, 17, speaks into a STUDENT NEWS CREW CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Tina Manion reporting live at Redwood High in Ukiah where local law enforcement as well as the FBI awaits the promised arrival of Nick Twisp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There comes a murmur from the crowd and Tina directs the student camera-man to the road on the ridge where... George's BMW pulls to a stop overlooking the school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. That's my car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd hushes as the door opens and Nick emerges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of the parking lot below, which looks like the kind of tu out one would expect of a Star Wars prequel.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE VARIOUS FACES OF THE CROWD
dialogues.text: staring up in silence. Estelle, Wally, Vijay, Trent, Dway George, Lacey, Paul... Nick gives a little wave as if he were a celebrity. The parking lot erupts with CHEERS of his name. A few Berkeley KIDS hold up a sign that reads I'M SINGLE, LET'S MINGLE. Then - shouts of warning from the megaphones. And as the flashers and sirens come to life, Nick jumps b into his father's car and peels out.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. BMW 325I, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: Nick glances in the rear view mirror as the cops bear thr the cloud kicked up in his wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick pops in a CD and turns up the Christmas music to dro out the sirens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He zips across the covered bridge, the train of law enforcement in hot pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. BMW 325I, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: He yanks the wheel hard and veers off onto the mountain r A few of the squad cars miss the turn and skid side-long through a picket fence. Nick takes the switchbacks at 60 per, wheels practically sliding off the turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BMW crests the hill and smashes through the chain lin gate.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. BMW 325I, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: As Nick watches the quickly approaching cliffs edge, he undoes his seat belt. He goes for the door handle, eyes going wide when he find power lock has engaged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BMW hurtles off the bluff and soars through the air, tires spinning, a plume of snow blowing off the hood. The car descends into a nose dive and flips completely up down, hitting the ice covered surface of Clear Lake with thundering SMACK. Police cars swerve to a stop at the edge of the bluff and crowd of officers and agents peer over the side at the ho in the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BMW descends toward us in a storm of air bubbles. As it gently touches down at the bottom of the lake, a so TRUMPET SOLO comes in pre-lap and we are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where a crowd of family, friends, and fans stand around i mourning garb over the funeral ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My only comfort regarding my untimely death is knowing my friends and family will do just fine without me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move from Lacey and Paul, the latter of which is waili away on the trumpet, to Lefty, his head hung low. Heather pulls his head to her breasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it would turn out Heather's vaginal canal is slightly misshapen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lefty humping Heather in the grass ala the scene in which met him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and thus completely compatible with Lefty's otherwise incongruent penis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little to the right... a little... RIGHT THERE! RIGHT THERE! RIGHTTHERERIGHTTHERERIGHTTHERE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...where we find Vijay glancing over at Taggarty as she smokes a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vijay would eventually manage to pin the car theft on me. But had lost the attention of Taggarty forever. Who by the way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...never would find her perfect A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taggarty at her wall. Ed Solomon lounges in the bed behin her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And would therefore start grading on a curve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a quick stroke of her pen, she changes Ed's grade fr B minus to a B plus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...where we find Joanie sniffling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joanie of course would get to continue to travel the world...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joanie serves up a beverage in first class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and she and   her breasts would probably go on   to have the wonderful life   that they deserve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CELEBRITY she is serving looks from her cleavage to h eyes. She gives a little smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...where we find Estelle weeping quietly against Wally's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally as it turns out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Estelle watches from the audience as Wally scribbles at h podium while ALEX TREBECK hosts inaudibly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...would go on Jeopardy and win, ensuring my mother's blessed rise to a higher economic status.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The answer on Wally's screen says WHO IS ALBERT CAMUS? Al Trebeck shakes his head, leaving Wally with only $1, but enough to best his two competitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...where we find George puffing on a cigar, Mrs. Crampton behind him, his hand resting on Dwayne's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...my father, no longer burdened with crippling child support payments, would now be able to afford the model BMW he always wanted...

dialogues.speaker: I/E. BMW M6SMG
dialogues.text: Dwayne sticks his head out the window and shouts with gle his flab flaps in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and would come to find the surrogate son he always wanted in Dwayne, the only organism alive that could possibly appreciate George's driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the car accelerates, we see the vanity plate reads THU ROD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaving just one last piece of business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And finally we arrive on Sheeni, expressionless. And as w continue to PAN we reach... Carlotta standing in the background. The bombshell haircu and thick glasses can barely be made out through her veil Paul finishes his trumpet solo and there is a moment of silence to observe the open casket and the SINGLE, LET'S MINGLE shirt and shorts that are being buried inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni makes her way toward the line of limos and hearses She approaches the distant Carlotta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Are you a friend of Nick's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlotta looks up, startled. She composes herself and sha Sheeni's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A terribly old friend. Carlotta Ulanksy. I'm sorry for your loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be, Carlotta. I am no doubt culpable for Nick's actions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, love does compel us to desperate acts. People cannot always act rationally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK/CARLOTTA (cont'd) The greater the love, the stronger the passions, the more reckless the crimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni lets go a slight, wistful smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Carlotta. Nick had wonderful a way of making me feel worthy of the pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dear, if there's one thing the demise of Nick Twisp has taught me, it's that self worth comes from within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni gives a pensive nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to stay the night, Carlotta? We can reminisce of our departed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my. A kind offer, but I really must...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just... I don't think I could bear to be alone tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlotta does her best not to look conflicted, but it sho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlotta hurriedly finishes tucking herself in while Shee brushes in the bathroom. Carlotta hastily switches out the light. Sheeni emerges i few small scraps of flimsy black lace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodness. What an attractive negligee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like it? I bought it in Santa Rosa last fall. I had hoped to wear it for Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, darling, I'm sure he would have found it most... Appealing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni crawls into bed. She cuddles close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like lying here with you, Carlotta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't think of anyone I'd rather lie here with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlotta furrows her brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except maybe Nick. If Nick were here, what do you suppose he would do to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make love to you I would think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take off that silly wig and make love to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni tugs off the wig and tosses it across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni! You knew!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, Nick. Did you really expect to fool your soul mate with such a disguise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick swoons, grasping her gauze-glazed nakedness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take me darling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as they engage in a feverish kiss, ROUSING HYMNS surg The church chorus' joyful song rings Hallelujah. The two lovers are entwined before an abstract RED BACKGROUND.

dialogues.speaker: LAS VEGAS OF THE BODY
dialogues.text: Into the NICK'S PENIS nightclub where champagne bottles P with the ringing in of a new era, and the Leopards ROAR, the stage erupts with fireworks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick sleeps with a grin on his face. He rouses at the tou of Sheeni's lips on his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My parents are at services. They won't be back for hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we have breakfast, my love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a lovely notion, darling. You go ahead downstairs and get things started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni hauls herself out of bed and grabs the phone off t cradle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calling Taggarty to report that you are not completely incompetent in the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I get to stay and hear my grade?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a chance, Mr. Twisp. Such things are reserved for girl talk only. And for good reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at him and he smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well, Sheeni. Don't be long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick prances into the living room in his underwear. He starts to head into the kitchen when he catches sight the full length mirror out of the corner of his eye. He s in front of the mirror and flexes his biceps. Admires himself. FranГ§ois appears in the mirror behind Nick, Thompson slu over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, good morning, FranГ§ois. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I sink? I sink now's are chance to run for ze hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick lowers his arms and furrows his brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, we are young, yes? Is the world not our oyster? Beaucoup des filles. Do you not want to know what it is like to make love to another girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do, but... We've come so far. What about Sheeni?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget Sheeni. Yes, she will always be ze first conquest, but all zis time you saught zis was ze end, ze one and only, when in fact it is only ze beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick lifts his eyebrows with dawning epiphany. In the reflection we can see behind Nick as Albert leaps the love seat and barks at the sound of approaching siren Nick runs to the window just in time to see half a dozen enforcement vehicles pull up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni, the police are here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ducks down from the window as a chopper buzzes overhea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick! Maybe I can sneak out the back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK TWISP! WE HAVE YOU SURROUNDED!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. How do they even know I'm alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I called them of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick spins to face her. She's standing in the doorway and there's not a hint of wrong-doing in her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thanks a pantsful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Nickie, it had to be done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... but why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't very well marry a wanted man, honey. Look at it this way, in a few months you'll be a free man and we can be together in Paris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks to FranГ§ois in disbelief. But the Frenchman j rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might as well break it to her now, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long pensive beat as Nick contemplates telling her he m never see her again. But behind Sheeni's air of control, finally sees the vulnerability he's had in his hands all along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FranГ§ois is right of course, but on the other hand, why be cruel? After all, Sheeni had managed to give me hope every step of the way. And if hope is what Sheeni would now need to go on, well then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As always, you are right, my love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni beams. FranГ§ois smacks his forehead with hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Frenchman in the mirror sticks the barrel of the Thom in his mouth and blows himself OUT OF FRAME just as... ...the front door bursts open and the FBI AGENTS surround Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agents lead Nick to the caravan of law enforcement pa in the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrested? Ha. It may not appear so, but the truth is... I've got the world on a string.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeni emerges from the home, Albert barking in protest. Nick strains against his cuffs to look over his shoulder her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Write often, Nickie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will, darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't worry about Albert. He'll be waiting for you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As FranГ§ois would remind me, I'm intelligent, healthy, virile, not violently ugly... On the whole I am splendidly equipped for this great adventure we call the human existence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FBI agents shove Nick into the back of their black Saturn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick watches out the back window as the car pulls away. A view of Sheeni waving in the road, Albert at her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, what jury would convict a teenager who acted out of love? And even if I do get to spend the next few months of my youth getting Dwayned by the inmates of the California Juvenile Correctional System, I did get my thirty two minutes of lovemaking with one of the most outstanding girls of this or any other epoch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick turns to face the front while behind him the waving figure gets ever more distant. A pensive moment as he actually questions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But was it all worth it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick revisits those thirty two minutes in his mind and it brings a smirk to his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet your left nut it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as Tom Jones' SHE'S A LADY kicks in, we...
